original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang mtshan ma ston te mtshan ma ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang mtshan ma ston te mtshan ma ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: He shows the signs of the Tathagata family. The sign is the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: de'i mtshon cha ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i mtshon cha ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: His weapon is the knowledge of the realm of phenomena.

original: sku mdog ni dkar po zhal bzhi pa g-yas zhal sngon po ltag pa'i zhal dmar ser g-yon ljang gu spyan gsum dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sku mdog ni dkar po zhal bzhi pa g-yas zhal sngon po ltag pa'i zhal dmar ser g-yon ljang gu spyan gsum dang ldan pa'o //
translated: His color is white, with a four-faced right face blue, the back face orange, the left face green, and three eyes.

original: dbu la rigs lngas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: dbu la rigs lngas brgyan pa'o //
translated: His head is adorned with the five families.

original: phyag brgyad pa dang / g-yas na 'khor lo ral gri / rdo rje dang rtse gsum mo //
analyzed: phyag brgyad pa dang / g-yas na 'khor lo ral gri / rdo rje dang rtse gsum mo //
translated: He has eight arms, with a wheel, sword, vajra, and trident in the right hands,

original: g-yon gyi phyag na 'dzin pa ni bum pa'i steng na rdo rje dang rin po che dang zhags pa dang ni lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: g-yon gyi phyag na 'dzin pa ni bum pa'i steng na rdo rje dang rin po che dang zhags pa dang ni lcags kyu'o //
translated: and a vase, vajra, jewel, and lasso in the left hands.

original: padma dang zla ba'i steng na rdo rje skyil krung mdzad pa /
analyzed: padma dang zla ba'i steng na rdo rje skyil krung mdzad pa /
translated: He sits in vajra posture on a lotus and moon.

original: sku me 'od kyi dkyil na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sku me 'od kyi dkyil na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: His body is in the center of a mass of firelight.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs so //
translated: This is the Tathagata family of the vajra family.

original: de bzhin du stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma rtsa ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma rtsa ba'i sngags so //
translated: Likewise, the root mantra of the Great Thousand Destroyer.

original: syad ya the dan aa tsa li la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: syad ya the dan aa tsa li la sogs pa'o //
translated: Syad yathedam a-cali, etc.

original: stong chen mo rtsa ba'i sngags de la /🔽'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: stong chen mo rtsa ba'i sngags de la / 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: The root mantra of the Great Thousand is recited as follows:

original: lus su rtogs pa dang dran pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: lus su rtogs pa dang dran pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The realization of the body and mindfulness, etc. refers to the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The calm abiding and insight are

original: thabs dang shes rab ste lha'i gzugs su bsgom pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ste lha'i gzugs su bsgom pa ni thabs so //
translated: the method and wisdom. The cultivation of the divine form is the method.

original: rig sngags stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: rig sngags stong pa nyid bsgom pa ni shes rab ste /
translated: The cultivation of the emptiness of the knowledge mantra is the wisdom.

original: des na thabs shes rab zung du 'brel pa'o ;
analyzed: des na thabs shes rab zung du 'brel pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, it is the union of method and wisdom.🔽What are the three samadhis?

original: ; ting nge 'dzin gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: ; ting nge 'dzin gsum gang zhe na /
translated: The three doors of liberation. The samadhi of emptiness with the aspect of emptiness,🔽the signless samadhi with the aspect of the signless, and the wishless samadhi with the aspect of wishlessness.🔽 The samadhi of emptiness is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of emptiness and seclusion. That is called the samadhi of emptiness.🔽The samadhi of the signless is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of the signless. That is called the samadhi of the signless.🔽The samadhi of wishlessness is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of wishlessness. That is called the samadhi of wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ste stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste de ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ste stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / dben pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste de ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The samadhi of emptiness is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of emptiness and seclusion. That is called the samadhi of emptiness.🔽The samadhi of the signless is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of the signless. That is called the samadhi of the signless.🔽The samadhi of wishlessness is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of wishlessness. That is called the samadhi of wishlessness.🔽The samadhi of emptiness is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of emptiness and seclusion. That is called the samadhi of emptiness.🔽The samadhi of the signless is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of the signless. That is called the samadhi of the signless.🔽The samadhi of wishlessness is the one-pointed mind with the aspect of wishlessness. That is called the samadhi of wishlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: The concentration of signlessness is🔽one-pointedness of mind in the aspect of peace and the aspect of signlessness.

original: zhi ba'i rnam pa @62b dang mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste de ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pa @62b dang mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste de ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the concentration of signlessness.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration of wishlessness?

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind in the aspect of impermanence and the aspect of suffering.

original: de ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the concentration of wishlessness.🔽As for the four bases of supernatural powers, they are: the base of supernatural power that is endowed with concentration arisen from aspiration and the volitional formations of abandonment,🔽the base of supernatural power that is endowed with concentration arisen from mind and the volitional formations of abandonment,

original: rdzu 'phrul kyi rkang pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul kyi rkang pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: the base of supernatural power that is endowed with concentration arisen from diligence and the volitional formations of abandonment,

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the basis of supernatural power that is accompanied by the meditative absorption of investigation and the volitional effort of abandoning.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four right efforts are as follows:🔽The first is the effort to generate the will to prevent the arising of nonvirtuous factors that have not yet arisen.🔽The second is the effort to generate the will to eliminate those that have already arisen.

original: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir mos pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir mos pa skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir mos pa skyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir mos pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir mos pa skyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir mos pa skyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang /
translated: The third is the effort to generate the will to give rise to virtuous factors that have not yet arisen.

original: skyes pa rnams 'phel zhing shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mos pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams 'phel zhing shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mos pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the effort to generate the will to increase and expand those that have already arisen and to perfect their cultivation.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are as follows:

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni /
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of the body is

original: yan lag 'dus pa sna tshogs kyi lus gzung 'dzin la sogs pa stong zhing mi dmigs pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag 'dus pa sna tshogs kyi lus gzung 'dzin la sogs pa stong zhing mi dmigs pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: to meditate on the body as empty and nonapprehensible in terms of the subject-object dichotomy and so forth.

original: tshor ba ni phyin yang med nang na yang med gnyis ka med par mi dmigs pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni phyin yang med nang na yang med gnyis ka med par mi dmigs pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Feeling is to meditate on the non-apprehension of feeling, whether it has gone out or not, or whether it is in between.

original: sems ni ming tsam ste mi dmigs pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni ming tsam ste mi dmigs pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Mind is to meditate on the non-apprehension of mind, which is merely a name.

original: chos ni chos la mi dmigs pa bsgom pa'o ;
analyzed: chos ni chos la mi dmigs pa bsgom pa'o ;
translated: Dharmas are to meditate on the non-apprehension of dharmas.

original: ; de ni theg pa chen po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: ; de ni theg pa chen po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of the Great Vehicle.

original: bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po nas yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po nas yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The four concentrations are as follows: The first concentration has five branches.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis nyon mongs pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis nyon mongs pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The two, investigation and analysis, are the branches of affliction.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba gnyis phan pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba gnyis phan pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The two, joy and pleasure, are the branches of benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa gnyis ka'i yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa gnyis ka'i yan lag go //
translated: One-pointed mind is the branch of both.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni yan lag kun la bsdus nas bzhir bshad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni yan lag kun la bsdus nas bzhir bshad do //
translated: The second concentration is explained as having four branches by subsuming all the branches.

original: nang rab tu dang ba gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: nang rab tu dang ba gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: Inner clarity is the branch of antidote.🔽The feeling of mental joy and pleasure is the branch of benefit.

original: tshor ba yid dga' ba dang bde ba phan yon gyi yan lag / sems rtse gcig pa gnyis ka gnas kyi yan lag go //🔽bsam gtan @63a * //
analyzed: tshor ba yid dga' ba dang bde ba phan yon gyi yan lag / sems rtse gcig pa gnyis ka gnas kyi yan lag go // bsam gtan @63a * //
translated: One-pointed mind is the branch of both.

original: gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The third concentration has five branches.

original: btang snyoms dran pa shes bzhin gsum gnyen po'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms dran pa shes bzhin gsum gnyen po'o //
translated: equanimity, mindfulness, and vigilance are the branches of counteracting.

original: tshor ba bde ba phan yon gyi'o //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba phan yon gyi'o //
translated: The feeling of pleasure is the branch of benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa gnyis ka gnas kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa gnyis ka gnas kyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the branch of both.

original: bzhi pa na yang yan lag lnga ste bzhir bshad do //
analyzed: bzhi pa na yang yan lag lnga ste bzhir bshad do //
translated: In the fourth, there are five branches, as explained above.

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, and the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: shes bzhin yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i tshor ba dang phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: shes bzhin yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i tshor ba dang phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Pure vigilance is the branch of counteracting and the branch of benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni gnyis ka'i gnas kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni gnyis ka'i gnas kyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the branch of both.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called four noble truths are:

original: gang gi 'du byed thams cad ma skyes par mthong ba des sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'du byed thams cad ma skyes par mthong ba des sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: One who sees all formations as unborn fully understands suffering.

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par mthong ba des kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par mthong ba des kun 'byung ba rab tu spangs so //
translated: One who sees all phenomena as non-arising has thoroughly abandoned the origin.

original: chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba des /
analyzed: chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba des /
translated: One who sees all phenomena as nirvana has realized cessation.🔽One who sees all phenomena as the path has cultivated the path.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: He has realized cessation.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med par mthong ba des /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med par mthong ba des /
translated: He has seen that all phenomena are unreal.

original: lam bsgoms so //
analyzed: lam bsgoms so //
translated: He has cultivated the path.

original: dbang po lnga zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po lnga zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The five faculties are

original: dad pa'i dbang po ni /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po ni /
translated: The faculty of faith

original: las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams la mngon par yid ches pa ste dbang po ni 'di'o zhes mngon par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams la mngon par yid ches pa ste dbang po ni 'di'o zhes mngon par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: is the faculty that is the clear comprehension of karma, result, the truths, and the jewels.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ni bya ba de la nges par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang po ni bya ba de la nges par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The faculty of effort is the definite engagement in that activity.

original: dran pa'i dbang po ni dran pa nyams pa med pa ste des ma rig pa'i skabs mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang po ni dran pa nyams pa med pa ste des ma rig pa'i skabs mi byed pa'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is the non-degeneration of mindfulness, since it does not allow ignorance to arise.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni sems rtse gcig pa ste des dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni sems rtse gcig pa ste des dbang byed pa'o //
translated: The faculty of concentration is the one-pointed mind, since it controls the mind.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po ni blang ba dang dor ba gnyis rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po ni blang ba dang dor ba gnyis rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the discernment of what to adopt and what to discard.

original: stobs lnga zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stobs lnga zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The five powers are

original: dad pa'i stobs la sogs pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dad pa'i stobs la sogs pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the power of faith, etc.,

original: dbang po lnga nyid rab kyi mthar gyur pa la gzhag go //
analyzed: dbang po lnga nyid rab kyi mthar gyur pa la gzhag go //
translated: is the placement of the five faculties themselves in the state of perfection.

original: de dag kyang dad pa'i stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs zhes mngon par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang dad pa'i stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes rab kyi stobs zhes mngon par brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are called the power of faith, the power of diligence, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: rjes su dran pa drug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa drug ces bya ba ni /
translated: The six recollections are as follows:

original: rten dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: rten dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa /
translated: Recollection of the three jewels, the supports

original: yul tshad med pa bzhi rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: yul tshad med pa bzhi rjes su dran pa /
translated: Recollection of the four immeasurables, the objects

original: shes bya bden pa gnyis rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: shes bya bden pa gnyis rjes su dran pa /
translated: Recollection of the two truths, the objects of knowledge🔽Recollection of method and wisdom🔽Recollection of the pledges of the five families, the causes

original: thabs shes rab rjes su dran pa dang / rgyu rigs @63b lnga'i dam tshig rjes su dran pa dang / 'bras bu sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: thabs shes rab rjes su dran pa dang / rgyu rigs @63b lnga'i dam tshig rjes su dran pa dang / 'bras bu sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Recollection of the result, buddhahood

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The seven bodhi factors are as follows:

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings skye ba med par rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum du skyu dur lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gis sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings skye ba med par rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum du skyu dur lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin rtogs pa'o //
translated: The bodhi factor of the discernment of phenomena, on the first bhumi, directly realizes the nonarising dharmadhatu, like a myrobalan plum in the palm of the hand.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gis gang du chos rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gis gang du chos rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa ma brjed pa'o //
translated: The factor of enlightenment that is right mindfulness is that by which one does not forget the object that has been realized, the general and specific characteristics of the dharmas.

original: brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gis bdag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la thogs pa med par 'jug pas sam dge ba gong nas gong du 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gis bdag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la thogs pa med par 'jug pas sam dge ba gong nas gong du 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The factor of enlightenment that is right effort is that by which one enters without obstruction into the realization of one’s own complete enlightenment, or by which one increases the wholesome ever higher.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gzhi ste //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gzhi ste //
translated: The factor of enlightenment that is right pliancy is the basis for the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus shing bal gyi 'dab ma ltar yang ba dang reg na bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus shing bal gyi 'dab ma ltar yang ba dang reg na bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, physical pliancy is the lightness of the body, like a cotton ball, and the pleasure of contact, and so forth.

original: sems shin tu sbyangs ba ni dmigs pa la rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: sems shin tu sbyangs ba ni dmigs pa la rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: Mental pliancy is the one-pointedness of the object.

original: rdzu 'phrul ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the supernormal knowledge of miraculous powers.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni /
translated: The factor of enlightenment that is right concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba gnas kyi yan lag ste ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas gnas ngan len gnas 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba gnas kyi yan lag ste ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas gnas ngan len gnas 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The limb of basis is the elimination of the afflictions, because one abides in concentration and transforms the basis of the negative tendencies.

original: btang snyoms yang dag ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag ni /
translated: Correct equanimity

original: ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag ste ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag ste ;
translated: is the limb of nature.

original: nyon mongs pa dngos su yang mi 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dngos su yang mi 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Although the afflictions do not actually occur,

original: dag pa yang med de gnyen po'i 'bad rtsol med pa'o //🔽dga' ba yang dag ni chos bdag med pa'i don mthong bas /
analyzed: dag pa yang med de gnyen po'i 'bad rtsol med pa'o // dga' ba yang dag ni chos bdag med pa'i don mthong bas /
translated: there is no purification because there is no effort to apply the antidote.

original: lus kyi dga' ba dang sems kyi bde ba phul du byung ba skyes pa ste phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: lus kyi dga' ba dang sems kyi bde ba phul du byung ba skyes pa ste phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Correct joy is the arising of the supreme joy of body and the supreme bliss of mind through seeing the meaning of the selflessness of phenomena. It is the limb of benefit.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called eightfold noble path

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mnyam gzhag gi don rjes thob kyis gcod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mnyam gzhag gi don rjes thob kyis gcod pa'o //
translated: is as follows: Correct view is the post equipoise discernment of the meaning of equipoise.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni kun slong ba'i 'phen pa nus pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni kun slong ba'i 'phen pa nus pa yod pa ste /
translated: Correct thought is the powerful projection of motivation,

original: kha dog ni legs par byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: kha dog ni legs par byang ba bzhin no //
translated: like the color of well-refined gold.

original: yang dag pa'i dag ni lta ba la yid ches par byed pa ste bshad pa dang 'bel gtam la sogs pa'i sgo nas yid ches pas so //🔽yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dag ni lta ba la yid ches par byed pa ste bshad pa dang 'bel gtam la sogs pa'i sgo nas yid ches pas so // yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni /
translated: Right view is the conviction of the path, because one has conviction in the path through the door of explanation, discussion, etc.

original: las kyi mtha' tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la yid ches pa ste lus dang ngag dang yid rnams dang / ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la yid ches pa ste lus dang ngag dang yid rnams dang / ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Right action is the conviction of the purity of morality, because it is the purity of the three actions of body, speech, and mind, and because it is preceded by and follows after knowledge.

original: @64a * // mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di la 'dod pas dben zhing sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa rtog ba dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: @64a * // mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni / 'di la 'dod pas dben zhing sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa rtog ba dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: The successive absorptions are the four absorptions, the four formless states, and the cessation of conceptualization and feeling.🔽The first absorption is the attainment of the first absorption, which is free from the desire realm, free from evil and nonvirtuous qualities, and endowed with thought and analysis.

original: dben ba las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben ba las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: It is born of seclusion, and is associated with joy and pleasure.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: In the second absorption, thought and analysis are pacified.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa /🔽ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the second concentration, which is without thought and investigation, and is born of concentration, filled with the joy and pleasure that come from meditative stabilization.

original: de dag dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan pas shes bzhin dang btang snyoms su gnas te /
analyzed: de dag dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral bas dran pa dang ldan pas shes bzhin dang btang snyoms su gnas te /
translated: He abides in the third concentration, which is without joy, and is filled with mindfulness and the pleasure that comes from equanimity.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba rnam par spyod cing btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis de la dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba rnam par spyod cing btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: The noble ones describe this as “abiding in mindfulness with pleasure, experiencing pleasure.”

original: de dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the fourth concentration, which is without pleasure or pain, and is filled with equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med sdug bsngal ba yang med btang snyoms dang dran pas yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas bde ba yang med sdug bsngal ba yang med btang snyoms dang dran pas yongs su dag pa /
translated: He has given up pleasure, given up pain, and previously given up mental well-being and mental unease. Thus he abides in equanimity and mindfulness.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He then attains and remains in the fourth meditative concentration.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par 'gyur zhing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar🔽bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽de la yang rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /🔽rnam shes mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par 'gyur zhing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes te nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // de la yang rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te / rnam shes mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He completely transcends perceptions of form, and so the perceptions of obstruction disappear. He no longer pays attention to perceptions of multiplicity, and so with the thought, ‘Space is infinite,’ he attains and remains in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /🔽cung zad kyang ma yod do zhes /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te / cung zad kyang ma yod do zhes /
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of infinite space, and so with the thought, ‘Consciousness is infinite,’ he attains and remains in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He completely transcends the sphere of infinite consciousness, and so with the thought, ‘There is nothing whatsoever,’ he attains and remains in the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba yang med do @64b zhes 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba yang med do @64b zhes 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of nothingness, he abides in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽Having completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, he abides in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te de ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te de ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the nine successive abodes of meditative absorption.

original: stobs bcu zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / rnam par byang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: stobs bcu zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / rnam par byang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The ten powers are: the power of knowing what is possible and impossible, the power of knowing one's own and others' higher and lower faculties, the power of knowing the diverse aspirations of beings, the power of knowing the diverse elements of beings, the power of knowing the path leading everywhere,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: the power of knowledge of the faculties of beings,🔽the power of knowledge of the superior and middling and inferior faculties of beings,🔽the power of knowledge of the meditative concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis,🔽the power of knowledge of the recollection of past lives,🔽the power of knowledge of death and rebirth,🔽and the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched bcu gcig dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched bcu gcig dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The eleven bases of liberation are:

original: mtha' dag sa dang / mtha' dag chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / mtha' dag rnam par shes pa dang / mtha' dag nam mkha'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag sa dang / mtha' dag chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / mtha' dag rnam par shes pa dang / mtha' dag nam mkha'o //
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, blue, yellow, red, white, infinite space, infinite consciousness, and nothingness.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination are:🔽ignorance, karmic formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death.

original: de yang rgyu dang rkyen 'brel pa ste phyi dang nang gi'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang rkyen 'brel pa ste phyi dang nang gi'o //
translated: These are the links of cause and effect, both internal and external.

original: phyi'i rgyu ni sa bon dang / myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu drug go //
analyzed: phyi'i rgyu ni sa bon dang / myu gu dang / sdong bu dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu drug go //
translated: The external causes are the six: seed, sprout, stem, leaf, flower, and fruit.

original: rkyen ni sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi dang / nam mkha'i dang / dus kyi khams drug go //🔽nang gi rgyu ni ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du /
analyzed: rkyen ni sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi dang / nam mkha'i dang / dus kyi khams drug go // nang gi rgyu ni ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du /
translated: The conditions are the six elements: earth, water, fire, wind, space, and time.

original: rten cing 'brel pa yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa yan lag bcu gnyis te /
translated: The internal causes are the twelve links of dependent origination, from ignorance to old age and death.

original: de la ma rig pa ni las legs nyes dang de'i 'bras bu mi shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i don mi shes pas rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni las legs nyes dang de'i 'bras bu mi shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i don mi shes pas rmongs pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is the confusion that comes from not knowing good and bad actions and their effects, and from not knowing the truth.

original: 'du byed ni las legs nyes byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni las legs nyes byed pa'o //
translated: Formation is the performance of good and bad actions.

original: rnam par shes pa ni las kyis bsgom pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni las kyis bsgom pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the foundation consciousness that is cultivated by action.

original: skye ba ni thog mar mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni thog mar mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: Birth is the initial linking up.

original: ming dang gzugs ni phung po lngar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni phung po lngar gyur pa'o //
translated: Name and form are the five aggregates.

original: skye mched drug ni dbang po rnams dod pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni dbang po rnams dod pa'o //
translated: The six sense spheres are the fully developed faculties.

original: reg pa ni yul dbang @65a * //
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dbang @65a * //
translated: Contact is the contact of the object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: po rnam shes gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: po rnam shes gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: The consciousness is the coming together of the three, and the determination.

original: tshor ba ni reg pa las byung ba rnam pa gsum myong ba'o //🔽sred pa ni tshor ba bden pa la zhen cing mi ngoms pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni reg pa las byung ba rnam pa gsum myong ba'o // sred pa ni tshor ba bden pa la zhen cing mi ngoms pa'o //
translated: Feeling is the experience of the three kinds of contact.🔽Craving is the desire for the feeling of pleasure and the insatiable desire for the feeling of equanimity.

original: len pa ni sred pa g-yon spyos nas 'dzin cing yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: len pa ni sred pa g-yon spyos nas 'dzin cing yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Clinging is the grasping and not letting go of the craving.

original: srid pa ni len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni len pa las byung ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Becoming is the contaminated action that arises from clinging.

original: skye ba ni srid pa mthun pa'i 'bras bu grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni srid pa mthun pa'i 'bras bu grub pa'o //
translated: Birth is the establishment of the result that is in accordance with the becoming.

original: dga' ba ni phung po smin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni phung po smin pa'o //
translated: Aging is the ripening of the aggregates.

original: shi ba ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: shi ba ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: Death is the destruction.

original: de dag ni gong ma gong mas 'og ma 'og ma grub par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni gong ma gong mas 'og ma 'og ma grub par byed do //
translated: The latter ones establish the former ones.

original: 'di dag yan lag lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di dag yan lag lngar 'gyur te /
translated: These are the five members:

original: dang po gsum ni 'phen pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: dang po gsum ni 'phen pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The first three are the projecting members.

original: de'i 'og ma bzhi ni 'phangs pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma bzhi ni 'phangs pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The four after that are the projected members.

original: de'i 'og ma gsum ni mngon par sgrub pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma gsum ni mngon par sgrub pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The three after that are the establishing members.

original: skye ba ni mngon par grub pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: skye ba ni mngon par grub pa'i yan lag go //
translated: Birth is the established member.

original: rga shi ni nyes dmigs kyi yan lag go //🔽rgyu de yang tshe gsum la rdzogs shing dum bu gsum du gnas te /
analyzed: rga shi ni nyes dmigs kyi yan lag go // rgyu de yang tshe gsum la rdzogs shing dum bu gsum du gnas te /
translated: Aging and death are the branch of the problem.🔽The cause is complete in three lifetimes and exists in three segments.

original: de yang dad po gsum la rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: de yang dad po gsum la rdzogs pa ni /
translated: The three segments are complete in three lifetimes.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed tshe snga mas bsdus so //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed tshe snga mas bsdus so //
translated: Ignorance and compositional activity are included in the former lifetime.

original: rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs skye mched drug reg pa tshor ba sred pa len pa bdun ni da ltar gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs skye mched drug reg pa tshor ba sred pa len pa bdun ni da ltar gyis bsdus so //
translated: Consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, and grasping are included in the present lifetime.

original: srid pa skye ba rga shi gsum ni phyi mas bsdus so //
analyzed: srid pa skye ba rga shi gsum ni phyi mas bsdus so //
translated: Becoming, birth, and aging and death are included in the future lifetime.

original: de la dum bu gsum ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe dang gsum ste de yang /
analyzed: de la dum bu gsum ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang tshe dang gsum ste de yang /
translated: The three segments are the three: afflictions, karma, and birth.

original: dang po brgyad dang dgu nyon mongs //
analyzed: dang po brgyad dang dgu nyon mongs //
translated: The first eight and the ninth are afflictions.

original: gnyis pa bcu pa las yin te //
analyzed: gnyis pa bcu pa las yin te //
translated: The tenth is karma.

original: lhag ma skye ba'i nyon mongs yin //🔽zhes pas dang po ma rig pa brgyad pa sred pa dgu pa /
analyzed: lhag ma skye ba'i nyon mongs yin // zhes pas dang po ma rig pa brgyad pa sred pa dgu pa /
translated: The rest are birth.

original: len pa gsum ni nyon mongs pa'o//
analyzed: len pa gsum ni nyon mongs pa'o//
translated: The first, ignorance, the eighth, craving, and the ninth, grasping, are afflictions.

original: gnyis pa 'du byed dang bcu pa srid pa gnyis ni las so //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'du byed dang bcu pa srid pa gnyis ni las so //
translated: The second, compositional activity, and the tenth, becoming, are karma.

original: lhag ma rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: lhag ma rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs /
translated: The remaining seven members are the life of the sentient being.

original: skye mched drug / reg pa /🔽tshor pa / skye ba /
analyzed: skye mched drug / reg pa / tshor pa / skye ba /
translated: Name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact,

original: rga shi dang bdun ni /
analyzed: rga shi dang bdun ni /
translated: feeling, birth, and aging-and-death.

original: tshe ste sdug bsngal zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: tshe ste sdug bsngal zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: These are also called the life of the sentient being and the suffering of the sentient being.

original: de yang dang po gsum las ni bar ba gnyis byung /
analyzed: de yang dang po gsum las ni bar ba gnyis byung /
translated: The first three members are the cause of the second two members.

original: de las tha ma bdun byung bas thog ma dang tha ma med cing des pa med par 'khor ro //🔽de lam rig pa dang 'du byed ni 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las te da ltar gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de las tha ma bdun byung bas thog ma dang tha ma med cing des pa med par 'khor ro // de lam rig pa dang 'du byed ni 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las te da ltar gyi rgyu'o //
translated: The last seven members are the effect of the first three members. Thus, the wheel of life turns without beginning or end, without interval.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ni da ltar @65b gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ni da ltar @65b gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The members of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, and feeling are the effect of the present.

original: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ni da ltar gyi nyon mongs pa dang las te /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ni da ltar gyi nyon mongs pa dang las te / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The members of craving, grasping, and becoming are the cause of the future.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The members of birth and aging-and-death are the effect of the future.

original: yang na dum bu gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na dum bu gsum ste /
translated: Or, there are three sections.

original: rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The affliction of the cause, the affliction of action, and the affliction of the result.

original: de la dang po nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum ni nyer len gyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la dang po nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum ni nyer len gyi rgyu yin la /
translated: Among these, the first three afflictions are the appropriating causes.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni lhan cig tu byed pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni lhan cig tu byed pa'i rkyen no //
translated: The affliction of action is the simultaneous condition.

original: 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni /
translated: The affliction of the result is

original: yan lag bdun te skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag bdun te skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: the seven members, which have the characteristic of the affliction of birth.

original: yang na rgyu bdun gyis bye brag gi 'bras bu yang bdun te /🔽phyin ci log gi rgyu la sogs pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu bdun gyis bye brag gi 'bras bu yang bdun te / phyin ci log gi rgyu la sogs pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Or else, the result is sevenfold, distinguished by seven causes:🔽The cause of error is ignorance.

original: zag pa med pa'i rgyu ni 'du byed do /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i rgyu ni 'du byed do /
translated: The cause of the uncontaminated is the formative forces.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las kyi bag chags yang dang yang du 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las kyi bag chags yang dang yang du 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the storeconsciousness is repeatedly deposited with the latent impressions of action.

original: srid pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The cause of existence is consciousness.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it links up with the next existence.

original: gnas su 'khrid par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas su 'khrid par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to the place.

original: kun du 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug go //
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug go //
translated: The cause of grasping is name-and-form and the six sense bases.

original: nye bar byed pa'i rgyu ni reg pa dang tshor pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar byed pa'i rgyu ni reg pa dang tshor pa'o //
translated: The cause of contact is contact and feeling.

original: sdud pa'i phyir ni srid pa dang len pa dang sred pa'o //
analyzed: sdud pa'i phyir ni srid pa dang len pa dang sred pa'o //
translated: The cause of attraction is craving, grasping, and existence.

original: sdud pa'i rgyu ni skye ba dang rga shi'o //🔽rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdud pa'i rgyu ni skye ba dang rga shi'o // rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of attraction is birth and old age and death.🔽He set in motion the wheel of the Dharma, which has twelve aspects.

original: bden pa bzhi la chos rnam pa bcu drug tu phye nas chos kyi 'khor lo lan bzhi gsum bcu gnyis bskor bas te /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la chos rnam pa bcu drug tu phye nas chos kyi 'khor lo lan bzhi gsum bcu gnyis bskor bas te /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is set in motion by the twelve aspects of the four noble truths.

original: de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal yi bden pa las phye ba gsum ste mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa la gsum gcig tu bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal yi bden pa las phye ba gsum ste mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa la gsum gcig tu bsdus pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is divided into three aspects: impermanence, suffering, and selflessness.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa la gsum rgyu kun 'byung ba dang rab tu skye ba dang rkyen gyi rnam pa gcig tu bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa la gsum rgyu kun 'byung ba dang rab tu skye ba dang rkyen gyi rnam pa gcig tu bsdus pa'o //
translated: The truth of origination is threefold: cause, origination, and strong generation.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba bzhi gcig tu bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba bzhi gcig tu bsdus pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is fourfold: cessation, peace, excellence, and definitive release.

original: lam gyi bden pa la lam dang rig pa dang sgrub pa dang nges par 'byung ba gcig tu bsdus pa rnams so //🔽de ltar skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa bzhi las phye ba'i bye @66a * //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la lam dang rig pa dang sgrub pa dang nges par 'byung ba gcig tu bsdus pa rnams so // de ltar skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa bzhi las phye ba'i bye @66a * //
translated: The truth of the path is fourfold: path, suitability, achievement, and definitive release.

original: brag gis / yan lag bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: brag gis / yan lag bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: Thus, the wheel of the Dharma is turned in twelve aspects, in accordance with the four truths, which are divided into these specific aspects.

original: dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa rnam pa bcu drug dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa rnam pa bcu drug dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation has sixteen aspects.

original: dran zhing dbugs nang du rgyu na yang dran zhing dbugs nang du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dran zhing dbugs nang du rgyu na yang dran zhing dbugs nang du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: When one is mindful and breathes in, one is mindful and knows that one is breathing in.

original: dran zhing dbugs phyir rgyu na yang dran zhing dbugs phyir rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //🔽dbugs nang du ring du rgyun yang dbugs nang du ring du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //🔽dbugs phyir ring du rgyu na yang dbugs phyir ring du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dran zhing dbugs phyir rgyu na yang dran zhing dbugs phyir rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so // dbugs nang du ring du rgyun yang dbugs nang du ring du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so // dbugs phyir ring du rgyu na yang dbugs phyir ring du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: When breathing out, he knows “I am breathing out.”🔽When breathing in long, he knows “I am breathing in long.”🔽When breathing out long, he knows “I am breathing out long.”

original: dbugs nang du thung du rgyun yang dbugs nang du thung du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs nang du thung du rgyun yang dbugs nang du thung du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: When breathing in short, he knows “I am breathing in short.”

original: dbugs phyir thung du rgyu na yang dbugs phyir thung du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs phyir thung du rgyu na yang dbugs phyir thung du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: When breathing out short, he knows “I am breathing out short.”

original: dper na 'khor lo bskor ba'am 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba'i mchan bu mkhas pa ni ring du bskor na ring du bskor zhes bya bar rab tu shes so ;
analyzed: dper na 'khor lo bskor ba'am 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba'i mchan bu mkhas pa ni ring du bskor na ring du bskor zhes bya bar rab tu shes so ;
translated: Just as a skilled turner or his apprentice, when making a long turn, knows “I am making a long turn,”

original: ; thung du bskor na thung du bskor zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ; thung du bskor na thung du bskor zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: or when making a short turn, knows “I am making a short turn,”🔽so too, when breathing in long, a monk knows “I am breathing in long”;

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa /
translated: Recollection of the Buddha,

original: chos rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa /
translated: recollection of the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa /
translated: recollection of the Saṅgha,

original: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa /
translated: recollection of morality,

original: gtong ba rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: gtong ba rjes su dran pa /
translated: recollection of generosity,

original: lha rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: lha rjes su dran pa /
translated: recollection of the gods,

original: skye pa rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: skye pa rjes su dran pa /
translated: recollection of birth,

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa /
translated: recollection of inhalation and exhalation,

original: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa /
analyzed: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa /
translated: recollection of death,

original: bzod pa rjes su dran pa dang / brtson 'grus rjes su dran pa dang / bsam gtan rjes su dran pa dang / shes rab rjes su dran pa dang / thabs dang shes rab rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa rjes su dran pa dang / brtson 'grus rjes su dran pa dang / bsam gtan rjes su dran pa dang / shes rab rjes su dran pa dang / thabs dang shes rab rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: recollection of patience, recollection of effort, recollection of concentration, recollection of wisdom, and recollection of means and wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha are:🔽The Tathāgata has no error,🔽no incoherence,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of mindfulness,

original: ca co mi mnga'o //🔽dngos po nyams pa mi mda'o //
analyzed: ca co mi mnga'o // dngos po nyams pa mi mda'o //
translated: no distraction,🔽no unconcentrated mind,

original: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o //🔽thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o // thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no various perceptions,🔽no indifference not derived from investigation,

original: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
translated: no complete abandonment of desire,🔽no complete abandonment of anger,🔽no complete abandonment of ignorance,🔽no complete abandonment of afflictions,🔽no complete abandonment of the perceptions and views of existence,🔽no complete abandonment of doubt,🔽no complete abandonment of desire for sensual pleasure,🔽no complete abandonment of envy,🔽and no complete abandonment of stinginess.

original: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in interest.

original: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in effort.

original: bsgom pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in meditation.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in samādhi.

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in liberation.

original: rnam par grol pa'i ye @66b shes yongs su gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol pa'i ye @66b shes yongs su gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any decline in the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: All his physical actions are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom.

original: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: All his verbal actions are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom.

original: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: All his mental actions are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa la 'jug go //
translated: He engages in the vision of wisdom that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa la 'jug go //
translated: He penetrates the vision of pristine awareness that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa la 'jug go //
translated: He penetrates the vision of pristine awareness that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the present.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The powers, the forms of fearlessness, and so on.

original: ye ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The forty-two letters

original: gzhan dag las 'di skad du 'dams shing 'di skad du ston to //
analyzed: gzhan dag las 'di skad du 'dams shing 'di skad du ston to //
translated: are taught in other scriptures as follows:🔽“Come here, son of noble family!

original: rigs kyi bu khyod tshur shog / yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod tshur shog / yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par gyis shig /
translated: Be skilled in the accomplishment of the letters.🔽Be skilled in the one letter, and be skilled in the two letters, up to the forty-two letters.

original: yi ge gcig la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gnyis nas yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gcig gis sbyangs pa'i rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge gnyis kyis byang ba'i rang bzhin thams
analyzed: yi ge gcig la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gnyis nas yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar la mkhas par gyis shig / yi ge gcig gis sbyangs pa'i rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge gnyis kyis byang ba'i rang bzhin thams
translated: Know that all the natures of the letters are contained in the one letter, and know that all the natures of the letters are contained in the two letters, up to the forty-two letters.

original: cad shes par gyis shig yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis byang ba'i rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis 'dus par sgoms shig / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgoms🔽shig ces ston to //
analyzed: cad shes par gyis shig yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyis byang ba'i rang bzhin thams cad shes par gyis shig / yi ge gcig tu yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis 'dus par sgoms shig / yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su yi ge gcig 'dus par sgoms shig ces ston to //
translated: Meditate on a single letter as being contained within the forty-two letters.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang yi ge gcig la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang yi ge gcig la mkhas pa yin /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is skilled in the one letter

original: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar la mkhas pa yin /🔽yi ge gcig gi nang du yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis 'dus par bsgom pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis kyi bar la mkhas pa yin / yi ge gcig gi nang du yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis 'dus par bsgom pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: is skilled in the forty-two letters.🔽He is skilled in meditating on the forty-two letters as being contained within a single letter.

original: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su yi ge gcig 'dus par bsgom pa la mkhas pa yin /🔽de ltar yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par bya ba la go mas shing /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis su yi ge gcig 'dus par bsgom pa la mkhas pa yin / de ltar yi ge mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par bya ba la go mas shing /
translated: He is skilled in meditating on a single letter as being contained within the forty-two letters.🔽Thus, he is skilled in the accomplishment of the letters,

original: yi ge med pa la mngon bar bsgrub pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge med pa la mngon bar bsgrub pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: and he is skilled in the accomplishment of the absence of letters.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la mkhas pa dang yi ge mkhas pa yin @67a * //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la mkhas pa dang yi ge mkhas pa yin @67a * //
translated: For example, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is skilled in the Dharma and skilled in letters.

original: te ; de'i chos la mkhas pa dang / yi ge la mkhas pas yi ge mang pos yi ge med pa'i chos ston kyang chos de yi ge'i rnam pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: te ; de'i chos la mkhas pa dang / yi ge la mkhas pas yi ge mang pos yi ge med pa'i chos ston kyang chos de yi ge'i rnam pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
translated: By his skill in the Dharma and skill in letters, he teaches the Dharma of no letters with many letters, yet that Dharma is not devoid of the aspect of letters.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar gyi rmad du byung ba'i chos te gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ngo mtshar gyi rmad du byung ba'i chos te gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin no //
translated: This is also a wondrous and marvelous Dharma of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, not shared in common with all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i rang bzhin de chos nyid kyi sku yin pas dper na stong pa la brten te glog snang ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i rang bzhin de chos nyid kyi sku yin pas dper na stong pa la brten te glog snang ngo //
translated: As for perfectly enlightened one, it is the dharmatā-kāya, the nature of emptiness. For example, based on emptiness, lightning appears.

original: glog la brten te 'od snang ngo //
analyzed: glog la brten te 'od snang ngo //
translated: Based on lightning, light appears.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi sku la brten te bsod nams kyi sku snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi sku la brten te bsod nams kyi sku snang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the body of merit appears based on the dharmakāya.

original: bsod nams kyi sku la brten te sprul pa'i sku snang ngo //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi sku la brten te sprul pa'i sku snang ngo //
translated: The nirmāṇakāya appears based on the body of merit.

original: yang gsum du bgrang ba yod mod kyi dngos po ni gsum du med do //
analyzed: yang gsum du bgrang ba yod mod kyi dngos po ni gsum du med do //
translated: Although there are three enumerations, there are not three entities.

original: mi skye mi 'gri  ba /
analyzed: mi skye mi 'gri  ba /
translated: It is unborn and unceasing.

original: rmi lam sgyu ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rmi lam sgyu ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a dream or an illusion.

original: tshangs pa de ni rig sngags kyi rgyal mo stong chen mo rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ba gdon thams cad las thar par byed pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa de ni rig sngags kyi rgyal mo stong chen mo rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ba gdon thams cad las thar par byed pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Brahmā, this is the Tathāgata’s spell called the queen of the great ten-thousand-fold world system, which destroys all grahas and liberates from all grahas.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang phyi ma la yang sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: It does not produce suffering in this world or the next.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One

original: 'das pa ma 'ongs pa da ltar yod pa rnams kyis rtag tu bsrung ba'o//
analyzed: 'das pa ma 'ongs pa da ltar yod pa rnams kyis rtag tu bsrung ba'o//
translated: is always protected by those who exist in the past, future, and present.🔽As many as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni grangs so //
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni grangs so //
translated: is the number.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi yum lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi yum lta bu'o //
translated: The seal of the Buddha is the mother of the Buddhas through all the doors of phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i sgo nas thams cad bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i sgo nas thams cad bsgrub pa ste /
translated: The accomplishment of the Buddha is the accomplishment of everything through that.

original: sangs rgyas ni sku gsum gyi sangs rgyas sgrub po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni sku gsum gyi sangs rgyas sgrub po //
translated: The accomplishment of the Buddha is the accomplishment of the Buddha of the three bodies.

original: chos sgrub ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos sgrub ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The accomplishment of the Dharma is

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob pa'o //
translated: the ultimate and the conventional.

original: dge 'dun sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i ngo bo byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i ngo bo byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the Sangha is the accomplishment of the Bodhisattvas and the Sravakas who are the essence of the Arhats.

original: tshangs pa sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thun mong gi dngos grub gzugs kyi khams kyi lha sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thun mong gi dngos grub gzugs kyi khams kyi lha sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of Brahma is the accomplishment of the gods of the world of Brahma and the world of form, which is the common attainment.

original: dbang po sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i dbang po la sogs pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i dbang po la sogs pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of Indra is the accomplishment of the lords of the gods of the desire realm who enjoy the five sensory objects.

original: 'jig rten skyong ba sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dbang phyug 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dbang phyug 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the world-protectors is the accomplishment of the universal monarch, lord of the world.

original: dbang @67b phyug sgrub pa ni gzhan pas dbang che bar gnas pa 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dbang @67b phyug sgrub pa ni gzhan pas dbang che bar gnas pa 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of lordship is the accomplishment of the lordship of the world, the state of being greater than others.

original: bden pa sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngag gi dbang phyug thob pa /
analyzed: bden pa sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngag gi dbang phyug thob pa /
translated: The accomplishment of truth is the attainment of the lordship of speech.

original: don dam kun rdzob go ba'o //
analyzed: don dam kun rdzob go ba'o //
translated: The understanding of the ultimate and the superficial.

original: lam sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lam sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the path is the accomplishment of the five perfections.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba sgrub ba'o zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa 'byung bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba sgrub ba'o zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa 'byung bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of dependent origination is the desire for the arising of ignorance, etc.

original: zla ba sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhin du bdud rtsi zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni zla ba bzhin du bdud rtsi zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the moon is the conquest of nectar like the moon.

original: nyi ma sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams rags pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams rags pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the sun is the possession of the gross world like the sun.

original: gza' sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten khams la mthu che bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: gza' sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten khams la mthu che bar grags pa'o //
translated: The planet accomplishment is known as having great power in the world system.

original: rgyu skar sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten khams su bzang ba dang ngan pa dang bye brag 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu skar sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten khams su bzang ba dang ngan pa dang bye brag 'byed pa'o //
translated: The lunar mansion accomplishment is the distinction of good and bad in the world system.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnas 'gyur ba'i me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnas 'gyur ba'i me long lta bu'i ye shes te /
translated: The basis of the foundation consciousness is the mirror-like wisdom.

original: stong pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i don rtogs pas /
analyzed: stong pa mtha' dag dang bral ba'i don rtogs pas /
translated: By realizing the meaning free from all emptiness,

original: rig sngags mtshan nyid pa ste /
analyzed: rig sngags mtshan nyid pa ste /
translated: it is the authentic knowledge mantra.

original: de'i mtshon bya me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i mtshon bya me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: Its illustration is the mirror-like wisdom.

original: mtshon pa stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma ste sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gyis rnam par byung ba'o //
analyzed: mtshon pa stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma ste sku mdog dang phyag mtshan gyis rnam par byung ba'o //
translated: The illustration is the great emptiness conqueror, arising with color and hand implements.

original: sku mdog mthing ga / zhal gsum pa /
analyzed: sku mdog mthing ga / zhal gsum pa /
translated: The color is blue, with three faces.

original: phyag drug pa /
analyzed: phyag drug pa /
translated: There are six arms.

original: dang po mthing ga / g-yas dkar ba /
analyzed: dang po mthing ga / g-yas dkar ba /
translated: The first is blue, the right is white,

original: g-yon dmar ba /
analyzed: g-yon dmar ba /
translated: and the left is red.

original: dbu la thod pa lngas brgyan pa /
analyzed: dbu la thod pa lngas brgyan pa /
translated: The head is adorned with five skulls.

original: dbu skra gyen du 'bar ba /
analyzed: dbu skra gyen du 'bar ba /
translated: The hair blazes upward.

original: spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum pa /
translated: There are three eyes.

original: zhabs phyed skyil du bzhugs pa /
analyzed: zhabs phyed skyil du bzhugs pa /
translated: The feet are in half-lotus posture.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du klu chen po dang gnod sbyin chen po gnyis so //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du klu chen po dang gnod sbyin chen po gnyis so //
translated: On the orb of the sun, two great nāgas and two great yakṣas.

original: g-yas pa na klu mnan pa g-yon pa na gnod sbyin mnan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa na klu mnan pa g-yon pa na gnod sbyin mnan pa'o //
translated: On the right, a nāga is suppressed; on the left, a yakṣa is suppressed.

original: g-yas kyi phyag gsum na rdo rje dang ral gri dang gri gug go //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyag gsum na rdo rje dang ral gri dang gri gug go //
translated: In the three right hands, a vajra, a sword, and a flaying knife.

original: g-yon pa gsum na zhags pa dang thod pa dang rtse gsum mo //
analyzed: g-yon pa gsum na zhags pa dang thod pa dang rtse gsum mo //
translated: In the three left hands, a noose, a skull cup, and a trident.

original: rgyan thams cad rin po che las byas pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad rin po che las byas pa /
translated: All the ornaments are made of jewels.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: The nature of the vajra family is illusory.

original: nyi ma'i gdan la me'i 'od rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: nyi ma'i gdan la me'i 'od rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid /
translated: On a sun seat, the light of fire is the essence of the buddhas of the five families.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma sangs rgyas la sogs pa thams cad de'i sgo nas 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma sangs rgyas la sogs pa thams cad de'i sgo nas 'grub pa'o //
translated: The queen of knowledge mantras, Destroyer of the Great Trichiliocosm, is all the buddhas and so forth.

original: sy'ad ya the dan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sy'ad ya the dan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Sādhu, sādhu means

original: 'di lta ste rig sngags 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rig sngags 'di'o //
translated: it is so, it is so.

original: sngags ni s'a le ka ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngags ni s'a le ka ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mantra is sāle kani.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rig sngags kyi rting la bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad @68a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rig sngags kyi rting la bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad @68a * //
translated: Then is after the knowledge mantra.🔽 At that time, the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni bkra shis pa'o //
analyzed: pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni bkra shis pa'o //
translated: Then means after the knowledge-mantra. At that time the Blessed One spoke these verses is the auspiciousness.

original: 'jig rten na 'am zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha dang mi la sogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na 'am zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha dang mi la sogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: In the world means in the trichiliocosm world system, with its gods, humans, and so on.

original: yang na 'das pa dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed yin /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed yin /
translated: Or in the past means the buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

original: yang na bgrang ba las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bgrang ba las 'das pa'o //
translated: Or it is beyond counting.

original: mtho ris dag na rin chen mchog yod pa //
analyzed: mtho ris dag na rin chen mchog yod pa //
translated: The supreme jewel exists in the heavens,

original: zhes bya ba ni mtho ris ni sangs rgyas kyi zhang khams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtho ris ni sangs rgyas kyi zhang khams te /
translated: The heavens are the buddha realms.

original: yang na sangs rgyas thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas thob pa'o //
translated: Or it is the attainment of buddhahood.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lha yi lhar gyur pa //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lha yi lhar gyur pa //
translated: The Tathagata, the god of gods,

original: mi yi mchog dang 'dir ni mtshungs pa med //
